page.title: 02Tannadice Village (cont)
page.content: { {The old school stood in the centre of {the village close by the mill.The old {school building is now used as a {private house.There used to be a lade {in the Bog Burn.This lade powered the {Meal Mill which stood at the junction {of the Bog Burn and the South Esk. { Tannadice was once a thriving {village.Most of the villagers worked {for the nearby farmers.The village {population exceeded one hundred people {at the turn of the century but today {only about thirty residents {remain.Today Tannadice is a {picturesque but sleepy village on a {quiet country road,the B957 which {meets the main North-South trunk {route,the A94,a mile to the east of {the village. }
